name: Merlion
header: The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore.
description: Its name combines "mer", meaning the sea, and "lion". The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city" or "kota singa".

name: Asian Civilisations Museum
header: Asian Civilisations Museum is an institution which forms a part of the four museums in Singapore
description: The other three being the Peranakan Museum at Old Tao Nan School, the National Museum of Singapore and the Singapore Art Museum.

name: Clarke Quay
header: Clarke Quay is a historical riverside quay in Singapore.
description: Located within the Singapore River Planning Area. The quay is situated upstream from the mouth of the Singapore River and Boat Quay.

name: Fort Canning Park
header: Fort Canning Park is a small hill.
description: In the southeast portion of the island city-state of Singapore, within the Central Area that forms Singapore's central business district

name: Orchard Road
header: Orchard Road is a major long road in the Central Area of Singapore.
description: A famous tourist attraction, it is an upscale shopping area of Singapore, with numerous internationally renowned department stores, restaurants and coffeehouses located in its vicinity

name: Singapore Flyer
header: Singapore Flyer is an observation wheel at the Downtown Core district of Singapore.
description: Officially opened on 15 April 2008, it has 28 air-conditioned capsules, each able to accommodate 28 passengers, and incorporates a three-story terminal building.

name: Marina Bay Sands
header: Marina Bay Sands is one of two winning proposals for Singapore's first integrated resorts
description: The other being the Resorts World Sentosa, which incorporates a family-friendly Universal Studios Theme Park (Universal Studios Singapore).

name: Gardens By The Bay
header: Gardens By The Bay is a nature park in the Central Region of Singapore.
description: Adjacent to the Marina Reservoir. The park consists of three waterfront gardens: Bay South Garden (in Marina South), Bay East Garden (in Marina East) and Bay Central Garden (in Downtown Core and Kallang)

name: Chinatown
header: Chinatown is a subzone and ethnic enclave located within the Outram district in the Central Area of Singapore.
description: Featuring distinctly Chinese cultural elements, Chinatown has had a historically concentrated ethnic Chinese population.
